description: mpiexec is the standardized MPI process launcher defined in the MPI-2 specification for starting parallel MPI applications across multiple processes and nodes. In Open MPI and MPICH implementations, mpiexec is functionally equivalent to mpirun and serves as the primary mechanism for launching distributed parallel applications using the Message Passing Interface (MPI) standard. mpiexec handles process spawning, resource allocation, standard I/O forwarding, signal propagation, and process management across heterogeneous computing environments. In HPC clusters, mpiexec is commonly used to launch GPU-aware MPI applications, enabling efficient communication between processes using technologies like CUDA-aware MPI, UCX, and NCCL for collective operations. It supports various transport layers including InfiniBand, RoCE, and TCP, and integrates with resource managers like Slurm and PBS for job scheduling.

installation.notes: Part of Open MPI or MPICH distribution. May be installed via package manager (apt install openmpi-bin or mpich), module system (module load openmpi), or compiled from source. For GPU-aware MPI, ensure the MPI implementation is compiled with CUDA support (--with-cuda for Open MPI) and UCX with GPU memory support.

global_options.description: Run this many copies of the program on the given nodes. This option indicates that the specified number of processes will be launched.
Comma-delimited list of hosts on which to run processes. Optionally, specify the number of slots per host using host:slots syntax.
Provide a hostfile (also called machinefile) containing the list of hosts on which to run. Each line can specify a host and optionally the number of slots.
Synonym for --hostfile. Provide a file containing the list of hosts.
Export the specified environment variable(s) to the remote nodes before executing the program. Can specify VAR or VAR=value format. Use multiple -x flags for multiple variables.
Pass context-specific MCA (Modular Component Architecture) parameters. Format is --mca <key> <value>. Controls runtime behavior including communication transports, memory allocation, and debugging.
Bind processes to the specified resource type. Common values: none, hwthread, core, l1cache, l2cache, l3cache, socket, numa, board. Controls CPU affinity for better performance.
Map processes according to the specified policy. Common values: slot, hwthread, core, socket, numa, node. Determines how processes are distributed across resources.
Rank processes according to the specified policy. Determines the order in which MPI ranks are assigned to processes.
Report any bindings for launched processes. Displays which CPU cores each MPI rank is bound to, useful for verifying affinity settings.
Display a table showing the mapped process layout. Shows which nodes and slots each rank is assigned to.
Display the allocation being used by the job including node names and slots.
Allow running more processes than available slots. Nodes are allowed to be oversubscribed even if the system does not permit it by default.
Use hardware threads (hyperthreads) as independent CPUs. By default, Open MPI only considers physical cores.
Launch N processes per node on all allocated nodes.
Launch N processes per socket on all allocated nodes.
Number of CPUs to allocate to each process. Useful for hybrid MPI+OpenMP applications.
Direct the stdout and stderr from each process to separate files with the specified base filename. Files are named basename.rank.stdout and basename.rank.stderr.
Merge stderr to stdout for all processes.
Tag each output line with the process rank and stream (stdout/stderr). Useful for distinguishing output from multiple processes.
Timestamp each output line with the time since launch.
Change to the specified directory before launching processes. By default, processes start in the directory where mpiexec was invoked.
Specify the Open MPI installation prefix on remote nodes if it differs from the local installation.
Copy the executable to remote nodes before starting execution. Useful when the executable is not on a shared filesystem.
Preload specified files on remote nodes before starting execution.
Suppress informational messages from mpiexec.
Be verbose. Increase verbosity of mpiexec output.
Print version information and exit.
Display help message and exit.
Set a timeout (in seconds) after which mpiexec will abort the job.
Obtain stack traces from all processes upon timeout or abnormal termination.
Enable debugging of the Open MPI runtime layer.
Provide an appfile, a file containing multiple application contexts for MPMD (Multiple Program Multiple Data) launch.
Set the PATH environment variable on remote nodes.
Enable recovery from process failure. Allows the application to handle process failures gracefully.
Re-spawn failed processes to maintain the original number of processes.
Maximum number of times to restart failed processes.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_MCA_btl
environment_variables.description: Specifies which byte transfer layer (BTL) components to use for point-to-point messaging. Common values include tcp, openib, sm (shared memory), self.
environment_variables.affects_command: Controls the transport layer for MPI communication. Use ^component to exclude a component.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_MCA_pml
environment_variables.description: Specifies the point-to-point management layer. Common values: ucx (for UCX transport), ob1 (for BTL-based transport).
environment_variables.affects_command: Selects the messaging layer implementation. UCX is preferred for high-performance networking.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_MCA_mpi_cuda_support
environment_variables.description: Enable or disable CUDA-aware MPI support.
environment_variables.affects_command: When enabled, MPI can directly transfer GPU memory without staging through host memory.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_MCA_opal_cuda_support
environment_variables.description: Enable CUDA support at the OPAL layer (lower-level than MPI layer).

environment_variables.name: OMPI_MCA_coll
environment_variables.description: Specifies collective communication components. Can use tuned, basic, hcoll (Mellanox HCOLL), or cuda (GPU-aware).
environment_variables.affects_command: Controls collective operation algorithms and hardware offload.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_COMM_WORLD_SIZE
environment_variables.description: Set by mpiexec at runtime. Contains the total number of MPI processes in MPI_COMM_WORLD.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_COMM_WORLD_RANK
environment_variables.description: Set by mpiexec at runtime. Contains the rank of the current process in MPI_COMM_WORLD.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_COMM_WORLD_LOCAL_SIZE
environment_variables.description: Set by mpiexec at runtime. Contains the number of MPI processes on the local node.

environment_variables.name: OMPI_COMM_WORLD_LOCAL_RANK
environment_variables.description: Set by mpiexec at runtime. Contains the local rank of the current process on its node.
environment_variables.affects_command: Read-only variable available to applications. Useful for GPU assignment.

environment_variables.name: PATH
environment_variables.description: System PATH environment variable. Must include the directory containing mpiexec and the MPI libraries.
environment_variables.affects_command: Required for mpiexec to be found and for remote process launching.

environment_variables.name: LD_LIBRARY_PATH
environment_variables.description: Library search path. Must include Open MPI libraries and any application dependencies.
environment_variables.affects_command: Required for dynamic linking of MPI libraries on remote nodes.

environment_variables.name: UCX_NET_DEVICES
environment_variables.description: Specifies which network devices UCX should use.
environment_variables.affects_command: When using UCX PML, controls which IB/RoCE devices are used for communication.

environment_variables.name: UCX_TLS
environment_variables.description: Specifies which UCX transport layers to use.
environment_variables.affects_command: Controls UCX transport selection for optimal performance.

environment_variables.name: CUDA_VISIBLE_DEVICES
environment_variables.description: Controls which GPUs are visible to CUDA applications.
environment_variables.affects_command: When exported with -x, controls GPU visibility per MPI rank.

environment_variables.name: NCCL_DEBUG
environment_variables.affects_command: When using NCCL with MPI, enables debugging output.

environment_variables.name: NCCL_IB_DISABLE
environment_variables.affects_command: Forces NCCL to use alternative transports.

environment_variables.name: OMP_NUM_THREADS
environment_variables.description: Number of OpenMP threads per process.
environment_variables.affects_command: When exported with -x, controls threading for hybrid MPI+OpenMP applications.

error_messages.message: There are not enough slots available in the system to satisfy the N slots that were requested by the application
error_messages.meaning: The number of processes requested exceeds the available slots (CPUs/cores) on the specified hosts
error_messages.resolution: Reduce -np value, add more hosts to the hostfile, increase slots per host, or use --oversubscribe to allow oversubscription.

error_messages.message: ORTE was unable to reliably start one or more daemons
error_messages.meaning: Open MPI could not launch daemon processes (orted) on remote nodes
error_messages.resolution: Verify SSH connectivity to remote nodes, check that Open MPI is installed at the same path, ensure firewalls allow ORTE communication ports.

error_messages.message: A daemon (pid XXXXX) died unexpectedly with status 255 while attempting to launch so we are aborting
error_messages.meaning: A remote daemon crashed, often due to misconfiguration or missing dependencies
error_messages.resolution: Check that Open MPI installation is consistent across all nodes. Verify LD_LIBRARY_PATH includes all required libraries.

error_messages.message: mpiexec was unable to find the specified executable
error_messages.meaning: The application executable was not found in the current directory or PATH
error_messages.resolution: Provide full path to executable, ensure it exists on all nodes, or use --preload-binary to copy it.

error_messages.message: All processes were killed by signal X
error_messages.meaning: All MPI processes received a fatal signal (e.g., SIGSEGV, SIGKILL)
error_messages.resolution: Debug the application for memory errors. For SIGKILL (signal 9), check for out-of-memory conditions using system logs.

error_messages.message: An MPI process has forked without calling MPI_Init first
error_messages.meaning: The application called fork() or similar without proper handling
error_messages.resolution: Set OMPI_MCA_mpi_warn_on_fork=0 to suppress warning if fork is intentional, or refactor code to avoid forking after MPI_Init.

error_messages.message: The call to cuMemHostRegister(0x...) failed. CUDA memory registration fails
error_messages.meaning: CUDA-aware MPI failed to register GPU memory, often due to CUDA IPC issues or driver problems
error_messages.resolution: Verify CUDA driver version compatibility, check GPU accessibility, ensure UCX CUDA support is enabled.

error_messages.message: UCX ERROR could not connect to remote peer
error_messages.meaning: UCX transport layer could not establish connection between processes
error_messages.resolution: Check network configuration, verify InfiniBand/RoCE connectivity, ensure UCX_NET_DEVICES points to correct interfaces.

error_messages.message: PMIX ERROR: UNREACHABLE in file pmix_server.c
error_messages.meaning: PMIx server communication failed, often in Slurm-integrated environments
error_messages.resolution: Check PMIx installation, verify Slurm PMIx plugin configuration, or try --mca pmix ^pmix3.

error_messages.meaning: The specified InfiniBand port is not in active state
error_messages.resolution: Check IB port status with ibstat. Verify cable connections and subnet manager is running.

error_messages.message: mpiexec has detected an attempt to run as root
error_messages.meaning: Open MPI prevents running as root by default for security
error_messages.resolution: Run as non-root user, or if root is required, use --allow-run-as-root flag.

interoperability.notes: mpiexec is the MPI-2 standard name for the MPI launcher and is functionally equivalent to mpirun in Open MPI (both are symlinks to the same binary). When running under Slurm, mpiexec can be replaced by srun for better integration with job scheduler. For CUDA-aware MPI operations, Open MPI must be compiled with --with-cuda and UCX must have GPU memory support. mpiexec works with various transport layers: UCX (recommended for modern systems), BTL/openib (legacy InfiniBand), and TCP. For multi-node GPU training, mpiexec is often used alongside NCCL for collective communications.

permissions.read_operations: Any user can launch MPI applications within their allocated resources
permissions.write_operations: mpiexec spawns processes and creates temporary files for communication; does not require elevated privileges for normal operation
permissions.notes: Running as root is disabled by default and requires --allow-run-as-root flag. Remote node access requires passwordless SSH or compatible launcher. In Slurm environments, access to nodes is controlled by the job scheduler allocation.

limitations: Process count limited by available slots unless --oversubscribe is used
Requires passwordless SSH or alternative launcher (like Slurm) for multi-node operation
CUDA-aware MPI requires Open MPI compiled with CUDA support and compatible GPU drivers
Maximum number of processes limited by system resources (file descriptors, memory)
InfiniBand/RoCE requires proper subnet manager configuration
Process binding options depend on hwloc library availability and accuracy
UCX transport may require specific versions for optimal GPU performance
Cross-version compatibility between Open MPI installations on different nodes is limited
Large-scale runs may require tuning MCA parameters for performance
GPU-direct RDMA requires compatible hardware and driver versions
